title: COVID-19 Safety and Vaccination | Rhythmix Cultural Works ®
description: Rhythmix Cultural Works is Alameda's destination for the arts that brings people of all ages together to experience and explore music, dance, visual art and educational opportunities.
cleaned_text: COVID-19 SAFETY GUIDELINES FOR RHYTHMIX CULTURAL WORKS Updated 2.6.23 COVID 19 SAFETY ACKNOWLEDGEMENT An inherent risk of exposure to COVID-19 exists in any public space where people are present. By attending Rhythmix classes or events you voluntarily assume all risks related to exposure to COVID-19, waiving all claims and potential claims against the organization. COVID-19 SAFETY GUIDELINE FOR RHYTHMIX EVENTS As of February 6, 2023, Rhythmix will no longer require proof of COVID-19 vaccination for entry to events. For the health and safety of the community, masks are strongly encouraged while indoors, but no longer required. COVID-19 SAFETY GUIDELINE FOR RHYTHMIX CLASSES Individual course instructors may set their own policies for each class. Please check with the course instructor for their latest COVID-19 policies. PLEASE DO NOT ATTEND CLASSES OR EVENTS IF ANY OF THE FOLLOWING IS TRUE: - You, or anyone in your household, have tested positive, or have been exposed to someone who has tested positive, for COVID-19 within 10 days prior to the event. - You have experienced any symptoms of COVID-19 within 48 hours prior to the class or event, including: fever, cough, chills, headache, sore throat, runny nose, vomiting, diarrhea, fatigue or any other [symptoms](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/symptoms-testing/symptoms.html)associated with COVID-19 identified by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
